== Who I am ==
I am a high-school student greatly interested in Ubuntu and its development. I am an Indian national, yet I live in Saudi Arabia. Began programming at the age of 9 and gave up gaming at that age as well. Right now, I am 14 years old. Began Ubuntu development work 8 months ago, with packaging learning.

== My Ubuntu story ==
I began using Ubuntu in late 2007, with Gutsy. Have tried Hardy, Intrepid, Jaunty, Karmic, Lucid and Maverick. I first heard about Ubuntu in early 2007 in a PC World magazine. Installed it when my cousin brother suggested "It will be good for you and your slow computer". I was surprised to see so cool desktop effects on my slow Pentium 4 computer. Got interested in Ubuntu development. Began translating, then bug reporting, then bug fixing (now from the last 6 months)!.

=== My involvement ===
I am involved in Ubuntu Packaging and Development (of course). Apart from that, I am involved in the Saudi Arabia LoCo Team, Translations, Ubuntu Technical Answers on Launchpad, bug triaging, etc. In other words, this application doubles up as a membership application.

=== Things I could do better ===
I have never worked on SRUs so that is a place where I have scope for improvement.

== Plans for the future ==
=== General ===
I want to fix more and more papercuts and other bugs. Many trivial bugs are neglected and never fixed, even after years. I would dedicate myself to fix these bugs.

=== What I like least in Ubuntu ===
Ubuntu is awesome! Just like what I mentioned above, I would fix trivial bugs. These hard-to-notice bugs do spoil user experience. 

Also, REVU and needs-packaging bugs are always neglected. This is something I don't like in Ubuntu. I have 4 packages awaiting sponsorship in REVU.
